> "I'm running for Nightstrike' s and mine life" said Darkfate while he 
> =
continued running

"What?" Vorpal's voice a maixture of anger and bafflemen=
t. "Malik 
couldn't have defeated that quickly? Why isn't he answering his =
radio?"

(TAG: Darkfate)

Even as Vorpral was expressing his ire and confus=
ion over the radio, 
the tunnel that the minions were traveling through sud=
denly burst into 
bright open skies as it suddenly ended!

Malik . . . or t=
hat is MARAUDER, as he renamed himself - roared out of 
the exit, the grind=
ing of gears distinctive as he shifted into his 
starfighter mode! 

The tu=
nnel they had been moving down emptied out several hundered feet 
above a i=
cey blue lake. Water crashed around the tunnel exit from 
somewhere above, =
and fell majestically down to the water below. 

The air here smelled crisp=
 and clean as small breezes rippled along the 
waters. Trees and unspoiled =
wildlife lay in all directions. A few birds 
sprang up with the unexpected =
intrusion of the Minions, skwaked and 
moved away from them. 

It is obviou=
s that the minions have exited somewhere a good distance 
away from the gre=
at battle that had taken place near the Ark. There was 
no hint of battle h=
ere, and mount St Hillary was now a mere spike in 
the distance rather then=
 the intimdating mount that she was!

(TAG: Darkfate)
